refnamediv.refpurpose: Sets a user-defined exception handler function

refentry.refsect1:
&reftitle.parameters;
callback
The function to be called when an uncaught exception occurs. This handler function needs to accept one parameter, which will be the Throwable object that was thrown. Both Error and Exception implement the Throwable interface. This is the handler signature:
voidhandler Throwableex
&null; may be passed instead, to push the built-in PHP exception handler onto the stack as the active handler.

&reftitle.notes;
Since set_exception_handler uses a stack, the correct way to restore the previous handler is to call restore_exception_handler, which pops the current handler off the stack. Do not re-register the previous handler by passing its return value back to set_exception_handler, as this pushes an additional entry onto the stack and can cause a memory leak in loops or long-running processes.
